alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Nobles; Rock (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 8:39PM CST until February 22 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 16 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Minnesota and south central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Wednesday. For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 AM Wednesday to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Periods of snow are expected through Wednesday morning with increasing winds. During lulls in snowfall tonight and early Wednesday, some patchy freezing drizzle is possible.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
